items.title: Trump to host Zelenskyy, Europeans at White House for Ukraine talks today
items.standfirst: President Trump is set to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders on Monday as the U.S. pursues a peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine.
items.content: President Trump is set to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders on Monday as the U.S. pursues a peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine.

items.title: Ukraine war live: ‘Russia must end this war,’ Zelenskyy says as he arrives in Washington for Trump talks
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president hopes ‘joint strength with America, with our European friends, will force Russia into a real peace’ as he joins leaders from Europe in Washington for crucial summit with Donald TrumpTrump rules out Ukraine reclaiming Crimea or joining Nato as European leaders gather in WashingtonA Russian drone attack on a five-storey apartment block in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv early Monday killed five people and wounded more than a dozen others, Ukrainian authorities said.The attack, which took place just before dawn, reduced part of the building to rubble and sparked fires on at least three floors, the region’s governor Oleg Synegubov said on Telegram. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelensky in Washington to discuss acceptable terms for peace deal
items.standfirst: Ukraine's future could hinge on a hastily assembled meeting Monday at the White House as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy brings with him an extraordinary cadre of European leaders to show U.S. President Donald Trump a united front against Russia. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondents in Ukraine and Brussels, Emmanuelle Chaze and Dave Keating.

Details by FRANCE 24 correspondents in Ukraine and Brussels, Emmanuelle Chaze and Dave Keating.

items.title: Trump pressures Zelenskyy before European leaders arrive in Washington | First Thing
items.standfirst: US president claims Zelenskyy could end the war ‘almost immediately’, as he ruled out Ukraine becoming Nato member or regaining Crimea. Plus, Minnesota angler helps solve 60-year-old cold caseDon’t already get First Thing in your inbox? Sign up hereGood morning.Donald Trump has piled pressure on his Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, before talks in Washington on Monday, saying the leader could end the war “almost immediately” if he wanted to.Will it be one meeting or more? Two – Trump will first meet Zelenskyy at 1.15pm EDT in the Oval Office, before a summit with the European leaders at 3pm, the White House said.What is the latest from Gaza? items.title: Trump to meet Zelenskyy with 2 big issues in focus: security guarantees and land
items.standfirst: The Ukrainian president will be joined at the White House on Monday by several key European leaders, as they look to find an end to the war between Russia and Ukraine.
items.content: The Ukrainian president will be joined at the White House on Monday by several key European leaders, as they look to find an end to the war between Russia and Ukraine. (Image credit: Saul Loeb)

items.title: Who will be at Zelensky's side for decisive talks with Trump on Ukraine-Russia war?
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said it was up to Russia to end its invasion, ahead of high-stakes talks on Monday with US counterpart Donald Trump, who is pressuring Ukraine to give up Crimea and abandon its NATO ambitions. The comments came hours before Zelensky and European leaders were scheduled to meet Trump in Washington, a follow-up to a summit between Trump and Putin in Alaska on Friday that failed to produce a ceasefire. Story by Morgan Ayre and Charlotte Lam.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said it was up to Russia to end its invasion, ahead of high-stakes talks on Monday with US counterpart Donald Trump, who is pressuring Ukraine to give up Crimea and abandon its NATO ambitions. The comments came hours before Zelensky and European leaders were scheduled to meet Trump in Washington, a follow-up to a summit between Trump and Putin in Alaska on Friday that failed to produce a ceasefire. Story by Morgan Ayre and Charlotte Lam.

items.title: Zelensky brings Europe's top leaders with him to meet Trump on ending Russia's war
items.standfirst: Ukraine's future could hinge on a hastily assembled meeting Monday at the White House as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy brings with him an extraordinary cadre of European leaders to show U.S. President Donald Trump a united front against Russia. Story by Morgan Ayre.
items.content: Ukraine's future could hinge on a hastily assembled meeting Monday at the White House as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy brings with him an extraordinary cadre of European leaders to show U.S. President Donald Trump a united front against Russia. Story by Morgan Ayre.

items.title: Trump piles pressure on Zelenskyy before European leaders arrive in Washington
items.standfirst: US president tells Ukraine leader to give up Nato and Crimea ambitions in run-up to White House talksRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesDonald Trump has put pressure on Volodymyr Zelenskyy before talks in Washington with European leaders on Monday, saying the Ukrainian leader could end the war “almost immediately” if he wanted to. The US president also ruled out allowing Ukraine to join Nato or retake Russian-occupied Crimea as part of negotiations with Moscow.Trump posted the remarks on his Truth Social platform on Sunday night, hours before he was due to meet the leaders of Britain, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, the EU and Nato at the Oval Office, amid fears the US president could try to pressure Kyiv into accepting a settlement favourable to Moscow. Continue reading...
items.content: US president tells Ukraine leader to give up Nato and Crimea ambitions in run-up to White House talksRussia-Ukraine war – latest news updatesDonald Trump has put pressure on Volodymyr Zelenskyy before talks in Washington with European leaders on Monday, saying the Ukrainian leader could end the war “almost immediately” if he wanted to. The US president also ruled out allowing Ukraine to join Nato or retake Russian-occupied Crimea as part of negotiations with Moscow.Trump posted the remarks on his Truth Social platform on Sunday night, hours before he was due to meet the leaders of Britain, Finland, France, Germany, Italy, the EU and Nato at the Oval Office, amid fears the US president could try to pressure Kyiv into accepting a settlement favourable to Moscow. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump tells Ukraine to give up Crimea and NATO hopes

items.content: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will meet with President Donald Trump on Monday afternoon at the White House, just days after Trump and Russia’s President Vladimir Putin left an Alaska summit without a ceasefire deal.

items.title: Live: Zelensky lands in US for Ukraine peace talks as Trump rules out 'getting back' Crimea
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and a number of European leaders arrived in Washington, DC on Sunday night to meet with US President Donald Trump the following day for talks aimed at ending the war with Ukraine. Trump said reclaiming Crimea or entering NATO were off the table for Kyiv, claiming that Zelensky could end the conflict "almost immediately" if he wanted to. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and a number of European leaders arrived in Washington, DC on Sunday night to meet with US President Donald Trump the following day for talks aimed at ending the war with Ukraine. Trump said reclaiming Crimea or entering NATO were off the table for Kyiv, claiming that Zelensky could end the conflict "almost immediately" if he wanted to. Follow our liveblog for the latest developments.

items.title: Remakes and sequels highlight this year's summer blockbuster season
items.standfirst: Summer is still Hollywood's busiest season and this year, studios seemed to be banking on nostalgia. Andres Gutierrez reports.
items.content: Summer is still Hollywood's busiest season and this year, studios seemed to be banking on nostalgia. Andres Gutierrez reports.

items.title: Ahead of Trump meeting, Zelenskyy says he won't give territory to Russia
items.standfirst: Ahead of his Monday meeting with President Trump, Ukrainian President Volodymry Zelenksyy says his country will not give up any territory to Russia, even as the White House insists potential land swaps will be necessary. Willie James Inman reports.
items.content: Ahead of his Monday meeting with President Trump, Ukrainian President Volodymry Zelenksyy says his country will not give up any territory to Russia, even as the White House insists potential land swaps will be necessary. Willie James Inman reports.

items.title: The stakes are high - and the unity of the alliance against Putin has never been so threatened
items.standfirst: When Volodymyr Zelenskyy and his European allies meet Donald Trump in Washington, a huge amount is at stake.
items.content: When Volodymyr Zelenskyy and his European allies meet Donald Trump in Washington, a huge amount is at stake.

items.title: NATO-like protection for Ukraine in focus as Zelensky, European leaders head for Trump meeting
items.standfirst: European and NATO leaders are joining Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Washington on Monday to present a united front in talks with President Donald Trump. US special envoy Steve Witkoff on Sunday said Russia is open to the idea of the US and its European allies offering Ukraine a security guarantee resembling NATO’s collective defence mandate.
items.content: European and NATO leaders are joining Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Washington on Monday to present a united front in talks with President Donald Trump. US special envoy Steve Witkoff on Sunday said Russia is open to the idea of the US and its European allies offering Ukraine a security guarantee resembling NATO’s collective defence mandate.

items.content: Ukraine and its allies were scrambling Sunday to respond to President Donald Trump's apparent shift toward Vladimir Putin's hardline position after their summit in Alaska.

items.content: A posse of European leaders will join the meeting between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington.

items.title: Putin says Alaska summit was 'frank and meaningful'
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin addressed senior officials in the Kremlin on the outcome of talks with President Donald Trump in Alaska.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin addressed senior officials in the Kremlin on the outcome of talks with President Donald Trump in Alaska.

clusters.ai_summary:
• President Trump met with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy in Washington on Monday.
• European leaders also attended the White House meeting.
• The meeting aimed to discuss a peace agreement between Russia and Ukraine.
• A Russian drone attack in Kharkiv killed five people and injured others.
• Putin will inform foreign partners about the US summit results.

clusters.title: Air Canada withdraws third quarter, full-year earnings forecast
clusters.neutral_headline: Air Canada Faces Strike, Suspends Forecasts, Delays Flights
bullet_summary: The union representing Air Canada's striking flight attendants on Sunday said it will remain on strike and spurn a government return-to-work order that they called unconstitutional
Air Canada said Sunday it has suspended its plan to resume limited flights after the union representing its flight attendants told members to defy a federal order to return to work

items.title: Air Canada withdraws third quarter, full-year earnings forecast
items.standfirst: Air Canada on Monday withdrew its third quarter and full-year earnings guidance due to a disruption in operations after its flight attendants went on strike. More to come
items.content: Air Canada on Monday withdrew its third quarter and full-year earnings guidance due to a disruption in operations after its flight attendants went on strike. More to come

items.title: Air Canada Suspends Forecast, Citing Flight Attendants’ Strike
Air Canada withdraws Q3, full-year earnings forecast
Air Canada flight attendants to continue strike despite government order
items.standfirst: Workers at Canada's flagship carrier defy back-to-work order as they stage first strike in 40 years.
items.content: Workers at Canada's flagship carrier defy back-to-work order as they stage first strike in 40 years.

items.title: Air Canada suspends restart plans after union defies return to work order
items.standfirst: Air Canada will resume flights Monday evening, claiming the union illegally directed flight attendants to defy a return-to-work order.
items.content: Air Canada will resume flights Monday evening, claiming the union illegally directed flight attendants to defy a return-to-work order.(Image credit: Graham Hughes)

items.title: Air Canada delays return to flights after union defies government order
items.standfirst: Canada's jobs minister intervened in the dispute in a bid to preserve "stability and supply chains".
items.content: Canada's jobs minister intervened in the dispute in a bid to preserve "stability and supply chains".

items.title: Air Canada flight attendants defy back-to-work order, continue strike
items.standfirst: The union representing Air Canada's striking flight attendants on Sunday said it will remain on strike and spurn a government return-to-work order that they called unconstitutional. The strike has stranded more than 100,000 passengers across the world during the peak summer travel season.
items.content: The union representing Air Canada's striking flight attendants on Sunday said it will remain on strike and spurn a government return-to-work order that they called unconstitutional. The strike has stranded more than 100,000 passengers across the world during the peak summer travel season.

items.title: Air Canada halts flight restart after union defies back-to-work order
items.standfirst: Air Canada said Sunday it has suspended its plan to resume limited flights after the union representing its flight attendants told members to defy a federal order to return to work.
items.content: Air Canada said Sunday it has suspended its plan to resume limited flights after the union representing its flight attendants told members to defy a federal order to return to work.

items.title: Canadian government orders arbitration to resolve Air Canada flight attendants' strike
items.standfirst: Air Canada suspended all operations Saturday morning after more than 10,000 flight attendants walked off the job over pay and scheduling disputes, prompting the Canadian government to step in.
items.content: Air Canada suspended all operations Saturday morning after more than 10,000 flight attendants walked off the job over pay and scheduling disputes, prompting the Canadian government to step in.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Air Canada withdrew its third quarter and full-year earnings guidance.
• Flight attendants went on strike, disrupting operations.
• The union defied a government return-to-work order.
• Air Canada suspended its plan to resume limited flights.
• The Canadian government ordered arbitration to resolve the strike.

clusters.title: Two decades of leftwing dominance end in Bolivia as rightwingers head to election runoff
clusters.neutral_headline: Bolivia's Election Heads to Runoff After Leftist Dominance Ends
bullet_summary: Bolivia is heading to its first ever presidential run-off vote after an election that confirmed the ousting of the left-
Rodrigo Paz, drew more votes than the right-wing front-runners, although not enough to secure an outright victory, early results showed

items.title: Two decades of leftwing dominance end in Bolivia as rightwingers head to election runoff
items.standfirst: Movimiento al Socialismo’s time runs out as economic crisis grips countryBolivia’s presidential election will go to a runoff for the first time, with two rightwing candidates competing for the presidency – marking the end of nearly 20 years of dominance by the leftist Movimiento al Socialismo (Mas).The candidate with the most votes, however, turned out to be a surprise: centre-right senator Rodrigo Paz Pereira, 57, who had started the campaign with just 3% support in opinion polls. Continue reading...
items.content: Movimiento al Socialismo’s time runs out as economic crisis grips countryBolivia’s presidential election will go to a runoff for the first time, with two rightwing candidates competing for the presidency – marking the end of nearly 20 years of dominance by the leftist Movimiento al Socialismo (Mas).The candidate with the most votes, however, turned out to be a surprise: centre-right senator Rodrigo Paz Pereira, 57, who had started the campaign with just 3% support in opinion polls. Continue reading...

items.title: Left-wing government ousted in historic Bolivia election
items.standfirst: Bolivia is heading to its first ever presidential run-off vote after an election that confirmed the ousting of the left-
items.content: Bolivia is heading to its first ever presidential run-off vote after an election that confirmed the ousting of the left-

items.title: Bolivia: Historic defeat for the left in presidential runoff vote
items.standfirst: Bolivia's presidential vote headed to an unprecedented runoff after elections Sunday that ended more than two decades of left-wing dominance in the Andean nation but signaled voters' trepidation about a major lurch to the right. Story by Camille Knight.
items.content: Bolivia's presidential vote headed to an unprecedented runoff after elections Sunday that ended more than two decades of left-wing dominance in the Andean nation but signaled voters' trepidation about a major lurch to the right. Story by Camille Knight.

items.title: Bolivia's presidential vote goes to runoff between centrist and right-wing candidates
items.standfirst: A dark horse centrist, Sen. Rodrigo Paz, drew more votes than the right-wing front-runners, although not enough to secure an outright victory, early results showed.
items.content: A dark horse centrist, Sen. Rodrigo Paz, drew more votes than the right-wing front-runners, although not enough to secure an outright victory, early results showed.(Image credit: Freddy Barragan, Arnulfo Franco)

items.title: Bolivia to hold presidential run-off between centrist and right-winger
items.standfirst: Early results show centrist Rodrigo Paz in the lead, with 32.8 percent of the vote.
items.content: Early results show centrist Rodrigo Paz in the lead, with 32.8 percent of the vote.

items.title: Bolivia's presidential vote heads to run-off between centre-right and right-wing candidates
items.standfirst: Centre-right senator Rodrigo Paz and right-wing former president Jorge "Tuto" Quiroga are headed to the second round of Bolivia's presidential elections following a first round of voting Sunday that brought an end to more than two decades of left-wing rule in the country.
items.content: Centre-right senator Rodrigo Paz and right-wing former president Jorge "Tuto" Quiroga are headed to the second round of Bolivia's presidential elections following a first round of voting Sunday that brought an end to more than two decades of left-wing rule in the country.

items.title: Bolivians go to polls in election that could end 20 years of leftist rule
items.standfirst: Rightwing candidates lead polling ahead of fragmented left amid country’s worst economic crisis in four decadesBolivians are going to the polls in an election that could mark a shift to the right and the end of nearly 20 years of rule by the leftist Movimiento al Socialismo (Mas).The party, which came to power with the first election of Evo Morales in 2005, risks losing its legal status if it fails to reach 3% of the vote – a threshold it has not hit in polls. Continue reading...
items.content: Rightwing candidates lead polling ahead of fragmented left amid country’s worst economic crisis in four decadesBolivians are going to the polls in an election that could mark a shift to the right and the end of nearly 20 years of rule by the leftist Movimiento al Socialismo (Mas).The party, which came to power with the first election of Evo Morales in 2005, risks losing its legal status if it fails to reach 3% of the vote – a threshold it has not hit in polls. Continue reading...

clusters.ai_summary:
• Bolivia's presidential election will go to a runoff vote.
• The election marks the end of nearly 20 years of left-wing rule.
• A centrist candidate, Rodrigo Paz, drew the most votes.
• Right-wing candidates will compete in the runoff.
• The runoff is the first in Bolivian presidential history.

clusters.title: Tens of thousands of Israelis protest for end to Gaza war
clusters.neutral_headline: Israelis Protest, Demand End to Gaza War and Hostage Release
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, CBS News, Guardian World and others

items.title: Tens of thousands of Israelis protest for end to Gaza war
items.standfirst: Israeli protesters demanding a deal to free hostages in Gaza attempted to shut down the country Sunday in one of the largest and fiercest protests in 22 months of war. Organizers, representing the families of hostages, asserted that hundreds of thousands of people took part. Story by Bryan Quinn.
items.content: Israeli protesters demanding a deal to free hostages in Gaza attempted to shut down the country Sunday in one of the largest and fiercest protests in 22 months of war. Organizers, representing the families of hostages, asserted that hundreds of thousands of people took part. Story by Bryan Quinn.

items.title: Protesters in Israel strike to demand ceasefire and hostages' release
items.standfirst: Protesters in Israel escalated their ongoing campaign on Sunday to secure the release of hostages held in Gaza.
items.content: Protesters in Israel escalated their ongoing campaign on Sunday to secure the release of hostages held in Gaza.

items.title: Thousands of Israelis protest war in Gaza, call for end to fighting
items.standfirst: Thousands of Israeli protesters on Sunday demanded a deal to secure the release of hostages still held by Hamas in one of the biggest demonstrations since the war in Gaza began. Debora Patta reports.
items.content: Thousands of Israeli protesters on Sunday demanded a deal to secure the release of hostages still held by Hamas in one of the biggest demonstrations since the war in Gaza began. Debora Patta reports.

items.title: Tens of thousands of protesters gather in Tel Aviv to demand end to Gaza war
items.standfirst: One of largest rallies in Israel since start of conflict follows general strike to press government to stop military actionTens of thousands of demonstrators have gathered in Tel Aviv to call for an end to the war in Gaza and the release of hostages, one of the largest demonstrations in Israel since the start of the fighting in October 2023.The rally on Sunday evening was the culmination of a day of nationwide protests and a general strike to pressure the government to halt the military campaign. “Bring them all home! Stop the war!” shouted the vast crowd, which had converged on the so-called Hostage Square in Tel Aviv plaza – a focal point for protesters throughout the war. Continue reading...
items.content: One of largest rallies in Israel since start of conflict follows general strike to press government to stop military actionTens of thousands of demonstrators have gathered in Tel Aviv to call for an end to the war in Gaza and the release of hostages, one of the largest demonstrations in Israel since the start of the fighting in October 2023.The rally on Sunday evening was the culmination of a day of nationwide protests and a general strike to pressure the government to halt the military campaign. “Bring them all home! Stop the war!” shouted the vast crowd, which had converged on the so-called Hostage Square in Tel Aviv plaza – a focal point for protesters throughout the war. Continue reading...

items.title: Huge crowds gather in Israel calling for hostage deal and end to Gaza war
items.standfirst: Large crowds fill 'Hostages Square' in Tel Aviv to call for fighting to cease and the release of all remaining hostages by Hamas.
items.content: Large crowds fill 'Hostages Square' in Tel Aviv to call for fighting to cease and the release of all remaining hostages by Hamas.

items.title: Mass rallies erupt across Israel as protesters demand end to Gaza war, hostage deal
items.standfirst: Mass protests erupted across Israel Sunday as tens of thousands called for an end to the war in Gaza and the release of hostages, one of the largest demonstrations in Israel since the start of the fighting in October 2023.
items.content: Mass protests erupted across Israel Sunday as tens of thousands called for an end to the war in Gaza and the release of hostages, one of the largest demonstrations in Israel since the start of the fighting in October 2023.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Tens of thousands of Israelis protested in Tel Aviv.
• Protesters demanded an end to the Gaza war.
• They also called for the release of hostages.
• The demonstration was one of the largest since the war began.
• Protests included a general strike across the country.

clusters.title: Spain, Portugal Wildfires Spread as Extreme Conditions Linger
clusters.neutral_headline: Wildfires Spread in Spain and Portugal Amid Extreme Heat
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, France24, BBC World

items.title: Spain, Portugal Wildfires Spread as Extreme Conditions Linger
Two killed fighting fires in Spain and Portugal as wildfires ravage peninsula
items.standfirst: Two firefighters have died across Spain and Portugal as the Iberian peninsula grapples with devastating wildfires exacerbated by an enduring heatwave. Thousands of firefighters have been deployed across southern Europe in recent weeks to beat back a series of deadly blazes.
items.content: Two firefighters have died across Spain and Portugal as the Iberian peninsula grapples with devastating wildfires exacerbated by an enduring heatwave. Thousands of firefighters have been deployed across southern Europe in recent weeks to beat back a series of deadly blazes.

items.title: Wildfires rage in Spain and Portugal as heatwave continues
items.standfirst: Thousands of firefighters have been battling huge blazes in Spain and Portugal on Saturday.

clusters.title: Amnesty slams Israel for ‘deliberately starving’ Palestinians in Gaza

items.content: Rights group condemns Israel for 'systematically destroying the health, wellbeing, social fabric of Palestinian life'.

items.title: Amnesty International says Israel deliberately starving Gaza's Palestinians
items.standfirst: Rights group Amnesty International on Monday accused Israel of enacting a "deliberate policy" of starvation in Gaza, as the United Nations and aid groups warn of famine in the Palestinian territory. Story by Morgan Ayre.
items.content: Rights group Amnesty International on Monday accused Israel of enacting a "deliberate policy" of starvation in Gaza, as the United Nations and aid groups warn of famine in the Palestinian territory. Story by Morgan Ayre.

items.title: Amnesty says Israel has 'deliberate policy' of starving Gaza's population
items.standfirst: Israel is carrying out "a deliberate campaign of starvation" in the besieged Gaza Strip, human rights group Amnesty International said Monday. Seven more people, two of them children, died from malnutrition-related causes in the Palestinian territory on Sunday, the occupied enclave's health ministry said.
items.content: Israel is carrying out "a deliberate campaign of starvation" in the besieged Gaza Strip, human rights group Amnesty International said Monday. Seven more people, two of them children, died from malnutrition-related causes in the Palestinian territory on Sunday, the occupied enclave's health ministry said.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Amnesty International accused Israel of starvation.
• The group said it is a deliberate policy.
• The UN and aid groups warn of famine.
• Seven more deaths were reported from malnutrition.
• The deaths occurred in the Gaza Strip.

bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Guardian World

items.title: Trump’s promise of a US manufacturing renaissance leaves experts scratching their heads
items.standfirst: Economists doubt US duties will bring about a resurgence of US factory jobs, notably due to Trump’s erratic tariff rollout Donald Trump’s hugely disruptive trade war is setting the stage for a manufacturing renaissance in the US, administration officials say. Outside the White House, many…
items.content: Economists doubt US duties will bring about a resurgence of US factory jobs, notably due to Trump’s erratic tariff rollout Donald Trump’s hugely disruptive trade war is setting the stage for a manufacturing renaissance in the US, administration officials say. Outside the White House, many…

items.title: Trump’s promise of a US manufacturing renaissance leaves experts scratching their heads
items.standfirst: Economists doubt US duties will bring about a resurgence of US factory jobs, notably due to Trump’s erratic tariff rolloutDonald Trump’s hugely disruptive trade war is setting the stage for a manufacturing renaissance in the US, administration officials say. Outside the White House, many economists are skeptical.Global trade experts point to many reasons they believe the president’s tariffs will fail to bring about a major resurgence of manufacturing, among them: Trump’s erratic, constantly changing policies, his unfocused, across-the-board tariffs, and his replacing Joe Biden’s carrot-and-sticks approach to brandish sticks at the world. Continue reading...
items.content: Economists doubt US duties will bring about a resurgence of US factory jobs, notably due to Trump’s erratic tariff rolloutDonald Trump’s hugely disruptive trade war is setting the stage for a manufacturing renaissance in the US, administration officials say. Outside the White House, many economists are skeptical.Global trade experts point to many reasons they believe the president’s tariffs will fail to bring about a major resurgence of manufacturing, among them: Trump’s erratic, constantly changing policies, his unfocused, across-the-board tariffs, and his replacing Joe Biden’s carrot-and-sticks approach to brandish sticks at the world. Continue reading...

clusters.ai_summary:
• Trump promised a US manufacturing renaissance.
• Economists doubt tariffs will bring factory job growth.
• Experts are skeptical of the plan.
• Trump's policies are seen as erratic.
• Trade experts cite reasons for skepticism.

items.content: Critics have denounced the vote as a sham that will be used to entrench the military government's power.

• The electoral commission has announced the date for the first phase of voting.

• This will be the first general election since the 2021 coup.

items.title: Terence Stamp, '60s British film legend and star of 'Superman,' dies at 87
items.standfirst: The English actor was best known for starring as the arch-villain in the original Superman films and for depicting the title character in Billy Budd.
items.content: The English actor was best known for starring as the arch-villain in the original Superman films and for depicting the title character in Billy Budd.(Image credit: Sonia Recchia)

items.title: Terence Stamp, star in "Superman" films, dies at 87
items.standfirst: The Oscar-nominated actor famously played arch-villain General Zod in "Superman" and "Superman II."
items.content: The Oscar-nominated actor famously played arch-villain General Zod in "Superman" and "Superman II."

clusters.ai_summary:
• Terence Stamp, a British actor, has died at the age of 87.
• He was known for his role as General Zod in the Superman films.
• Stamp was nominated for an Oscar for his role in Billy Budd.
• He starred in the original Superman films as the arch-villain.
• Stamp was a prominent figure in British cinema during the 1960s.
